{{pp-semi-blp|small=yes}} {{Infobox person | name = Criss Angel | image = Criss angel (cropped version).jpg | birth_name = Christopher Nicholas Sarantakos | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1967|12|19|mf=y}} | birth_place = [[Long Island, New York]], [[United States|U.S.]] | occupation = Magician/Entertainer/TV Personality | net_worth = [[United States dollar|US$]]17 million (2010) | years_active = 1997–present | spouse = JoAnn Winkhart (2002–2005) (divorced) | website = [http://www.crissangel.com Criss Angel.com] [http://www.themagicplace.com The Magic Place] [https://twitter.com/#!/crissangel Twitter] [http://www.facebook.com/CrissAngel Facebook] }} '''Christopher Nicholas Sarantakos''' (born December 19, 1967), better known by the [[stage name]] '''Criss Angel''', is an [[United States|American]] [[Magic (illusion)|magician and illusionist]]. He is best known for starring in the television show, ''[[Criss Angel Mindfreak]]'' and his live performance illusion show ''[[Criss Angel Believe]]'' in artistic collaboration with ''[[Cirque du Soleil]]'' at the [[Luxor Las Vegas|Luxor casino]] in [[Las Vegas Valley|Las Vegas]], [[Nevada]]. Angel is also the creator of the MagicPlace.com.
==Early life== Angel's childhood interest in magic grew as he aged and by the time he graduated from [[East Meadow High School]], he decided to pursue a career as a professional magician instead of attending college as his parents wanted.<ref name= LVSbio>[http://www.lasvegassun.com/criss-angel/bio/ Criss Angel biography], ''Las Vegas Sun''. Retrieved November 20, 2009.</ref> Angel is of Greek descent.<ref name=people.com>{{cite web|title=people.com|url=http://www.people.com/people/article/0,,20041633,00.html|quote="Look, I'm Greek," he said}}</ref><ref name="Kopka2010">{{cite book|author=Deborah Kopka|title=Eastern Europe and Russia: Eastern Europe and Russia|url=http://books.google.com/books?id=mIGoq6MHY2QC&pg=PA49|accessdate=6 April 2012|date=25 November 2010|publisher=Lorenz Educational Press|isbn=978-1-4291-2252-8|pages=49–}}</ref><ref name="Gall2009">{{cite book|author=Timothy L. Gall|title=Worldmark Encyclopedia of Cultures and Daily Life: Americas|quote=Other well-known Greek Americans in the arts include actors Michael Chiklis, John Stamos, and Melina Kanakaredes; magician Criss Angel; and writer Jeffrey Eugen- ides (2003 Pulitzer Prize winner)|url=http://books.google.com/books?id=F7hZAAAAYAAJ|accessdate=6 April 2012|date=1 May 2009|publisher=Gale|isbn=978-1-4144-4890-9}}</ref>
==Television career== ===''Criss Angel Mindfreak''=== Criss Angel was the creator, director, and executive producer of the [[A&E Network]] show ''[[Criss Angel Mindfreak]]''. Seasons 1 and 2 were filmed at [[Planet Hollywood Resort and Casino|The Aladdin]] in Las Vegas, with Season 3 at the [[Luxor Las Vegas]]. Premiering on July 20, 2005, the show's illusions have included [[walking on water]], [[Levitation|levitating]], walking up the side of [[Luxor Las Vegas|Luxor Hotel]] (in the light of 39 focused lamps that can be seen from space<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.luxor.com/attractions/attractions_property_highlights.aspx |title=Property Highlights - Stairway To The Stars |accessdate=9 January 2009|author=MGM Mirage |year=2009|publisher=[[MGM Mirage]]}}</ref>), [[Flight|floating]] between two buildings, causing a [[Lamborghini]] to [[Magic (illusion)#Categories of effects|disappear]], surviving in an exploding [[C-4 (explosive)|C4]] Crate, [[Sawing a woman in half|cutting himself in half]] in full view of an audience and getting run over by a steamroller while lying on a bed of broken glass. While making season 3 Angel was injured jumping out of a moving car and stopped production for 2 weeks.
===''Criss Angel Believe''=== He made numerous special television [[guest appearance]]s on ''[[WWE Raw]]'', ''[[The Oprah Winfrey Show]]'', ''[[The Late Late Show with Craig Ferguson]]'', ''[[Jimmy Kimmel Live!]]'', ''[[The Megan Mullally Show]]'', ''[[The Ellen DeGeneres Show]]'', ''[[AVN Award|AVN Awards Show 2007]]'' and ''[[Larry King Live]]'' on [[CNN]]. ''[[The Tonight Show]], ''[[Late Show with David Letterman]]'', ''[[America's Got Talent]]", ''[[The Rosie O'Donnell Show]]'', and introducing honoree [[Ozzy Osbourne]] on the [[VH1 Rock Honors]] awards. He also made a guest acting appearance on the hit television shows ''[[CSI: NY]]'', ''[[Las Vegas (TV series)|Las Vegas]]'' and ''[[Rules of Engagement (TV series)|Rules of Engagement]]''.
The show was originally developed for [[Broadway theatre|Broadway]] and was titled ''Criss Angel MINDFREAK''. Eventually, the show evolved into ''Believe'' when he entered a partnership with Cirque du Soleil and the Luxor's parent company, [[MGM Mirage]], financed the show with $100 million.<ref name=LAT101208>Lee, Chris. [http://www.latimes.com/entertainment/news/celebrity/la-ca-angel12-2008oct12%2C0%2C768184.story "Criss Angel believes that you will too"], ''Los Angeles Times'', October 12, 2008. Retrieved November 4, 2008.</ref>
After several delays, the show was set for a gala opening on October 31, 2008, with preview shows in late September.<ref name=LATB063008>Abowitz, Richard. [http://vegasblog.latimes.com/vegas/2008/06/cirque-and-ange.html "Cirque and Angel's 'Believe' delayed"], LATimes.com, 30 June 2008. Retrieved November 4, 2008.</ref><ref name=LATB090208>Abowitz, Richard. [http://vegasblog.latimes.com/vegas/2008/09/previews-of-ang.html Previews of Criss Angel's 'Believe' delayed again], LATimes.com, 2 September 2008. Retrieved November 4, 2008.</ref><ref name=LATB091308>Abowitz, Richard. [http://vegasblog.latimes.com/vegas/2008/09/breaking-news-m.html "Breaking news: More delays for Angel's 'Believe'"], LATimes.com, September 13, 2008. Retrieved November 4, 2008.</ref> The initial preview was not well received, with thoroughly negative audience reactions.<ref name=LATB092908>Abowitz, Richard. [http://vegasblog.latimes.com/vegas/2008/09/sneak-peak-at-a.html Sneak {{sic|nolink=y|peak}} at Criss Angel's 'Believe'], LATimes.com, 29 September 2008. Retrieved November 4, 2008.</ref><ref name=LVRJ092908>Elfman, Doug. [http://www.lvrj.com/news/29875759.html "Angel's 'Believe' magic: Miffed fans disappear"], ''Las Vegas Review-Journal'', 28 September 2008. Retrieved November 4, 2008.</ref> The show opened to equally harsh reviews which cited a lack of the magic Angel is known for, as well as a confusing and uninteresting theme. Reviewers felt neither Angel nor Cirque du Soleil were able to perform to their capabilities.<ref name=LATB103108>Abowitz, Richard. [http://vegasblog.latimes.com/vegas/2008/10/criss-angels-be.html "Criss Angel's 'Believe' hard to believe"], LATimes.com, 31 October 2008. Retrieved November 4, 2008.</ref><ref name=LAT110108>Brown, Joe. [http://www.lasvegassun.com/news/2008/nov/01/illusion-elusive-angels-believe/ "Illusion is elusive in Angel’s ‘Believe’"], ''Los Angeles Times'', November 1, 2008. Retrieved November 4, 2008.</ref><ref name=LVRJ110308>Elfman, Doug. [http://www.lvrj.com/news/33740174.html New Criss Angel show is unbelievably bad, sad], ''Las Vegas Review-Journal'', November 3, 2008. Retrieved November 4, 2008.</ref><ref name=LAT110308>Johnson, Reed. [http://www.latimes.com/entertainment/news/celebrity/la-et-criss3-2008nov03,0,6640068.story "Criss Angel, in a word: unbelievable"], ''Los Angeles Times'', November 3, 2008. Retrieved November 4, 2008.</ref>
In April 2009, Angel ended a performance of ''Believe'' by "hurling obscene insults" at blogger [[Perez Hilton]], an audience member. Hilton reportedly had texted to his fans during the performance that the show was "unbelievably BAD" and that he'd "rather be getting a root canal", and word had gotten back to Angel by the end of the performance.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.lvrj.com/news/43243067.html |title=NORM: Coarse shout-out stirs up Tweeters |publisher=Lvrj.com |date=2009-04-19 |accessdate=2010-09-26}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|date =20 April 2009 |url=http://vegasblog.latimes.com/vegas/2009/04/perez-hiltons-excellent-vegas-adventure.html |title=Perez Hilton's excellent Vegas adventure, from Criss Angel to Miss USA | The Movable Buffet |publisher=Vegasblog.latimes.com |date=2009-04-20 |accessdate=2010-09-26 |deadurl=yes}} {{Dead link|date=January 2012|bot=RjwilmsiBot}} [http://webcache.googleusercontent.com/search?q=cache:http://vegasblog.latimes.com/vegas/2009/04/perez-hiltons-excellent-vegas-adventure.html archive]</ref> Cirque du Soleil later apologized to Hilton for Angel's remarks.<ref>{{cite news| url=http://vegasblog.latimes.com/vegas/2009/04/perez-hiton-gets-apology-from-cirque-angel-remains-silent.html |title=Perez Hiton gets apology from Cirque; Angel remains silent | The Movable Buffet |publisher=Vegasblog.latimes.com |date=20 April 2009 | accessdate=2010-09-26 |deadurl=yes}} {{Dead link|date=January 2012|bot=RjwilmsiBot}}</ref>
In 2010 the ''Las Vegas Sun'' critic John Katsilometes, after being unimpressed by the initial show, said that the show had improved by reducing the narrative elements and focusing on the magic.<ref>[http://www.lasvegassun.com/blogs/kats-report/2011/jan/02/believe-it-angels-work-has-markedly-improved-luxor/]</ref> In 2011 the ''Toronto Star'' wrote: “The show is easily the most exciting thing now on stage in Vegas!” <ref>{{cite news| url=http://pqasb.pqarchiver.com/thestar/access/2230019331.html?FMT=ABS&FMTS=ABS:FT&type=current&date=Jan+5%2C+2011&author=Richard+Ouzounian&pub=Toronto+Star&edition=&startpage=E.5&desc=Sin+City+offers+plenty+of+theatrical+second+chances | first=Richard | last=Ouzounian | title=Sin City offers plenty of theatrical second chances | date=January 5, 2011}}</ref>
===''Phenomenon''=== Starting in October 2007 he appeared as a judge on ''[[Phenomenon (TV series)|Phenomenon]]'', with [[Uri Geller]] and in a CNN interview about the show he told [[Larry King]] "no one has the ability, that I'm aware of, to do anything supernatural, psychic, talk to the dead. And that was what I said I was going to do with ''Phenomenon''. If somebody goes on that show and claims to have supernatural psychic ability, I'm going to bust [him] live and on television."<ref>{{cite news | url=http://www.magicopen.com/criss-angel-secrets/mindfreak-star-criss-angel-destroys-self-proclaimed-psychics-reputation-on-tv/ | title=Larry King Live: Mindfreak Criss Angel | publisher=CNN |date=October 30, 2007| first=| last= | accessdate =2007-07-07}}</ref>
{{wikinews|Criss Angel challenges Uri Geller and Jim Callahan over paranormal claims}} On the October 31, 2007 episode of the reality show ''Phenomenon'', [[Mentalism|Paranormalist]] Jim Callahan performed a [[Conjuration|summoning]], purportedly of author [[Ray Hill|Raymond Hill]], to help discover the contents of a locked box.<ref>{{cite news | url=http://www.msnbc.msn.com/id/21576519/ | title=Angel sparks altercation on ‘Phenomenon’ | publisher=[[MSNBC]] |date=2007-11-01 | first=| last= | accessdate =2007-11-07}}</ref> Although fellow judge [[Uri Geller]] praised the performance, Angel called it "comical" and subsequently challenged both Callahan and Geller to guess the contents of two envelopes he pulled out of his pocket, offering a million dollars of his own money to whoever could do so. This led to an argument between Callahan and Angel, during which Callahan walked toward Angel and called him an "ideological bigot", with the two pulled apart as the show promptly went to a commercial break. Angel has since revealed the contents of one envelope and at the unveiling he challenged Geller one more time. Geller responded, "Although we were born one day apart - I was born on the 20th of December and you on the 19th - a lot of years between us - 40 years, you were one year old when I came out with my spoon bending..." Criss Angel cut him off at this point, saying, "I guess this is a 'no,'" and proceeded to open the envelope. The envelope contained an [[index card]] with the numbers "911" printed on it for [[September 11 attacks|September 11, 2001]]. Angel's explanation was this: "If on 9-10 somebody could have predicted that 9-11 was going to happen, they could have saved thousands of lives". The other envelope's contents was scheduled to be revealed on the first episode of Season 4 of ''Criss Angel: Mindfreak''.
==Other media== [[File:Criss Angel and Tommy Lee.jpg|thumb|Angel with [[Tommy Lee]]]]
===Appearances=== In 2007, Angel appeared as fictional illusionist Luke Blade in an episode of ''[[CSI: NY]]'', called "Sleight Out of Hand". On March 8, 2010, he was a [[List of WWE Raw guest stars|special guest star]] on the [[WWE]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://pwtorch.com/artman2/publish/TV_Reports_9/article_39658.shtml|title=Caldwell's WWE Raw Report 3/8: Complete coverage of Cena vs. McMahon, Taker-Michaels confrontation|publisher=PWTorch|accessdate= 2010-03-10|date=2010-03-08|first=James|last=Caldwell}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.lasvegassun.com/news/2010/mar/09/criss-angel-makes-magic-wwes-emrawem-portland/|title=Criss Angel makes magic at WWE's Raw in Portland|work=[[Las Vegas Sun]]|date=2010-03-09|accessdate=2010-03-10|first=Robin|last=Leach}}</ref> In 2011, Angel appeared in an [[Orville Redenbacher]] Pop-Up Bowl popcorn commercial.<ref>[http://adage.com/article/mediaworks/orville-redenbacher-popcorn-bowl-spot-s-recalled/228159/]</ref>
===Books=== Angel is the author of the book ''Mindfreak: Secret Revelations'', published by HarperEntertainment, 2007 (ISBN 978-0061137617).
===Charity=== Angel created the BeLIEve Foundation 'Believe Anything is Possible - A JDS Foundation'.<ref>[http://magicplace.com/entertainment-network/magician/criss-angel]</ref>
==Personal life== In 2002, Angel married his longtime girlfriend JoAnn Winkhart (now JoAnn Sarantakos). The couple filed for divorce four years later.<ref name="LVSbio"/> Although Angel was seen with his wife in the buried alive illusion (season 1, episode 6, 2005) and the body suspension illusion (season 1, episode 5, 2005), she was not credited as his wife; rather, she was listed as "Criss's Girl". In November 2008, Angel began dating [[Holly Madison]], former girlfriend of [[Hugh Hefner]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.people.com/people/article/0,,20237408,00.html?xid=rss-topheadlines|title=Criss Angel: Holly Madison Is a 'Beautiful' Person| last=Gray| first=Mary| date=1 November 2008 |work=People.com|accessdate=2008-11-10}}</ref> The relationship ended in February 2009.<ref>[http://news.yahoo.com/s/eonline/20090225/en_celeb_eo/101658;_ylt=AlWUqt8IVfXODBZ6mhgsjE1xFb8C "Holly Madison and Criss Angel Kaput"], ''Yahoo News'', 25 February 2009.</ref>
He proposed to Sandra Gonzalez on September 7, 2011 in Cabo San Lucas during a sunset dinner.<ref>Johnson, James. [http://www.inquisitr.com/143638/illusionist-criss-angel-proposes-to-sandra-gonzalez/ "Illusionist Criss Angel Proposes To Sandra Gonzalez"], ''Inquisitr.com'', 20 September 2011.</ref>
